rComments: CMPS 164 IS NOT AN EASY CLASS. This is a class for people who are serious about coding and game engines. Arnav is flexible and reasonable with his grading and assignments. Don't stress about programming physics TOO much... He will work with you if you're having problems and knows his stuff backwards and fowards

This is for Winter 2013: Arnav was awesome. His one test was extremely easy and really stayed out of your way most of the time. It is unfortunate that most kids in this class can barely program. The only gripe was the stupid weekly recap stuff.

Class was relatively easy, despite the fact that more than half the students couldn't program to save their life. Arnav clearly explained all content as needed; if you didn't get it, you probably dropped from cs. This rating is for Winter 2013.
Keeps rejecting game ideas without clearly giving guidance for what is wrong, leading to more rejected ideas.

The class improves a bit every year, but it's still got a long ways to go. Lectures aren't any better than just reading the slides at home. He kept changing the final project criteria, up until the last week. Expects you to program above the level of the assignments he gives. If you don't teach yourself above that level, the midterms are brutal.

His class is interesting, but lectures tend to be disorganized. On the plus side he is very approachable, and helps with our lab assignments. Also he has experience with Game Engines, which is pretty rare for a professor.

Don't know what they were thinking hiring him to lead a class of students. Can't keep control of the classroom because he won't raise his voice above the level of the students chatting. Guess that's just to help cover that he doesn't know what he's lecturing about and can't fully explain the slides he used which were  by another Professor.

Prof. Jhala is very approachable, knowledgeable,  and always ready to help. I agree that there was some problems with his teaching (disorganization and inconstancy in grading), but it was his first time he thought this course and I truly believe that in the future he will be a good teacher.

Aside from being completely useless as a teacher, he is also a rather useless for helping with any other problems. Didn't know how to get a program I needed to start coding when my computer wouldn't download it and felt it more appropriate to teach color theory in a game programming class. Also, final project grading criteria was posted after the p

Horrible teaching. I didn't learn a thing in this class until the tutor took over in the 6th week. We had 10 weeks to make a game, but everything we used in our game we had to learn on our own from online tutorials (and a little from the books). Jhala might know his stuff (I don't know), but he doesn't know how to teach it.
Completely agree with two previous ratings

:(   I have no words no explain how awful his class is. I still do not understand how he got the job in UCSC. I think he either doesn't have knowledge in subject, or he doesn't know how to teach (maybe both). Avoid if possible.

Complete fail. Just reads someone else's slides. Forgot to  bring 60 exam copies and made several big mistakes on the mid-term. Clueless about C# and XNA, constantly asks TA for help. TA took over the lectures, he just stands and listens. Maybe he should do some of the assignments as well..
